recipe:
Simple Dahl served with ancient grains and coriander
1 cup yellow split peas 3 cups water or vegetable stock 4-6 garlic cloves chopped 4 inches ginger grated 1 teaspoon cumin 1/2 teaspoon coriander 1/2 teaspoon turmeric 1/2 teaspoon Garam masala 1/2 teaspoon chilli Salt to taste Olive oil Root veggies you have in your fridge chopped and frozen spinach
Soak split peas over night then put on higher heat and bring to the boil. Cook for 20 minutes. Mean while heat some olive oil in a small fry pan and cook garlic then ginger for 3-5 mins add the spices and cook a further 2 minutes. Add a little water to the pan and add to split peas. Add all the veggies and cook until veggies are soft (about 30-40 mins.) Add spinach and stir until completely mixed through. Serve with ancient grains and coriander sprinkled on top.
